The second step involved evaluating the effects of the environmental variables on the rodents; matrix α was the influencing parameter. We used the environmental coefficients matrix H to simplify the assessment of the environmental influences. Environmental matrix H was constructed with rows representing the same environmental variable in different years and columns representing the proportions of different environmental variables (precipitation, temperature, relative humidity, NDVI, and TVDI) in the same year. The matrix C
kj represent the proportion of rodent species between years, the same as in Eqs ( 2) and ( 3). The environmental coefficient matrix α was calculated based on C and H to determine how the environmental variables influenced the rodent population dynamics:
